intro: Xanthisma texanum var. texanum, commonly known as the Texas sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of Texas. It is a low-growing perennial with slender, branching stems and small, yellowish-green leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces clusters of tiny, pale yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to withstand drought and high temperatures. Xanthisma texanum var. texanum plays a role in stabilizing sandy soils and providing nectar for pollinators.
